Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No 6 dispatch Consular Series, Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia December 13/90 Alexander Clark to Department of State
Subject
Tariff
Synopsis.
I have given the gola basis as there is two rates me gola the other currency
No 6 Dispatch Consular Series, Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia December 13, 1890 Mr Alexander Clark to the Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State Wasington D.C.

Sir; I have the honor respectfully to acknowledgee the receipt of your printed tariff circular of dates October 15th 1890, Instructing me to prepare and forward to the department a report upon the duties on importes and exports as established by the Laws of the Rpublic of Liberia &c in accordance with Said instruction, I am pleased to report that I have carefully comiled a schedule list of the custom duties collected under the present tariff Laws of Liberia, giving a list of export duties and the Free list &c
Inclose find Inclosures No one. Marhia_pages- No. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6
alexander Clark Minister Resident and Consul General of the U.S.
Liberia Report of Consul General Clark
Customs duties Collected under the present tariff Laws of Liberia.
Tariff Classification Rates, duties, unit, duties

Silk pieces goods per yard .25 Cashmere, merine, and other wousted per Yard .06 Satin ,, do .06 Flannel or Serge ,, do .05 ,, ,, ,, ,, Suits each 100 ,, ,, ,, Coats do .50 ,, ,, Trousers do .37 ,, ,, vests do .25 Woolen shirts do .12 Cotton ,, do .12 Trimmed Hats do .50 Miscellaneous: Paint per pound .01 Kerosine per case of 6 Gallon .40 Conisoir Soap per Pound .02 Fancy Toilet Soap per do .06 Starch per do .06 Crockery Ware: Trade Plates () Doen .012 Basins, not over 12 in., per a .012 do over 12 in do do .025 Number per Foot .00 1/2

Free List Sienes, Lye, Agriculture, Tornplements and mackinery of all kinds thread, Tools, Sawing Machines, Palm- Kennel, Coffee Bags Shoohs, Hoop-June, Rivets, Tenter Hooks; Musical Instruments, Books for use of missions and schools.

Exports Duties & Tariff Palm oil .01 Palm Kernels .02 Camwood per Ton 350 Ivory per 16 .05 rubber & Gutta pencha per Pound .06 The above export duties are payable in currency except Rubber; all articles not mentioned pay no duty

Tobaco. Leaf Tobaco per pound .05 Manufactured Tobaco per do .25 Cigars each each 51 cigaretts each each 0 1/2 Gents and ladies under clothing, lace embroidery & Exging &c Advalorum Duty of 50% per 50%
